page.title: 12Ecology - Nesting Birds
page.content: The auks are perhaps the most spectacular group nesting on the island with the guillemots and razorbills nestig on the sheer cliffs while the puffins nest in burrows on the top. The Kittiwake is a small gull which builds a large nest of debris on the most inaccessible ledges. The gull which has caused most comment in the past 20 years is the Herring gull. A highly adaptable predator its numbers have been doubling every 6 years. In 1972 there were an estimated 42000 birds on the island and faced with the prospect of large parts of the island becoming devegetated and soilless the NCC embarked on a carefully planed cull. By 1976 there were about 5000. Other nesting birds include eider duck, oystercatcher, shag, fulmar and lapwing.
